title: 110_s413
content: The Act titled "Community Choice in Real Estate Act" clarifies that real estate brokerage and management activities are not considered banking or financial activities. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 has been amended to specify that real estate brokerage and management activities are not considered financial activities. This includes acting as an agent for a buyer in real estate transactions. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 has been amended to exclude real estate brokerage and management activities from being considered financial activities. This involves acting as an agent for a buyer, seller, lessor, or lessee of real property, listing or advertising real property, providing advice, bringing parties together, and negotiating contracts related to real estate transactions. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 has been amended to exclude real estate brokerage and management activities from being considered financial activities. Real estate management activity involves offering or providing real estate management services to the public, including activities that require registration or licensing as a real estate agent or broker under applicable law. Real estate management activities involve offering or providing services to the public, such as procuring tenants, negotiating leases, maintaining security deposits, billing and collecting rental payments, and making various payments related to real property. The curr_chunk discusses exceptions to real estate management activities for bank holding companies and their affiliates related to managing real property. Exceptions to real estate management activities for bank holding companies and their affiliates are discussed, ensuring that current activities are not affected by any provisions or determinations made. Financial holding companies are allowed to engage in authorized activities without restriction. The Secretary may not determine that real estate brokerage or management activities are financial in nature, incidental to financial activities, or complementary to financial activities. Definitions are based on the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 allows national banks and their subsidiaries to engage in real estate management activities related to properties owned by them without restrictions. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 allows a bank or its subsidiary to engage in activities authorized for national banks on December 6, 2001.
